revised_title: Late-Glacial Deposits and Flora at Nazeing in the Lea Valley, North London
tldr: This study examines Late-Glacial deposits at Nazeing in the Lea Valley, North London, providing insights into the region's geological history and the flora of the time. The research bridges the gap between the well-known 'Arctic Plant Bed' and the established Post-Glacial vegetational and climatic sequence. The findings reveal that the Late-Glacial period favored the spread of certain plant categories, which is crucial for understanding the history of the British Flora.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Paleontology
